resources.string: Warning: enabling development mode is designed for Sense testers only. It is not recommended for normal use: your data will not be accessible anymore on CommonSense!

What is VU Univerity Amsterdam
VU University Amsterdam is a university located in Amsterdam, The Netherlands. We are conducting research on sensing using mobile phones. This app is a portion of that research.

What is Sense?
Sense is a company that gathers context information to improve your communication and coordination activities.

What is the Life Tag app?
This app allows you to "Tag Your Life" activities, and simultaneously gathers your sensor data and sends it to Sense's online CommonSense system. We want to create a system that can classify and predict your activities based on sensor information from your phone. Only a system that knows what you are doing can help you to do it. This app is designed to allow us to gather the information we need to achieve that goal. For now the app only gathers information, but using this data we hope that a future version will be able to "Tag Your Life" without your direct action.

What is CommonSense?
CommonSense is Sense's intelligent data storage, where advanced pattern recognition and sensor fusion can be performed, so the system can learn to recognize what you are doing and how to help you. It is still under heavy development so its powers are still limited, but we hope this app will change that in the near future.

How do I get to see the gathered data?
You can see what information we have gathered on CommonSense's web interface:http://common.sense-os.nl. You can also see your Tags using the application.

Are you spying on me?
No. We only use your gathered data to conduct research. Your data is only accessible to you and to researchers at Sense and the VU University Amsterdam, as well as those you explicitly shared information with. However, when we use your information for research we anonymize it and aggregate it with information from others. We do not share your information outside of Sense and the VU University Amsterdam. Furthermore, you are always welcome to use the CommonSense web interface to delete some or all of the data we have collected using this application.

After weeks of waiting, the CommonSense web interface is finally in a presentable state. Although it is still far from finished, you can have a peek at the collected data by logging in at http://common.sense-os.nl.

We recommend using a regular computer instead of your Android, because the interface is not really suited for smaller screens.

Happy experimenting!
Are you sure you want to sign out this user from CommonSense?

The Sense platform gathers data about your activities and shares it with the CommonSense data storage.

Over time, it will learn to recognize your behaviour and current status. This makes it possible for your phone to help you avoid repetitive or stupid tasks, and alert you about interesting events.

Please login, or register a free CommonSense account.
